article.headline: Lamar 86, Tulsa 78
article.story: BEAUMONT, Texas (AP) -- Alan Daniels scored 25 points as Lamar won its fifth straight game 86-78 over Tulsa on Saturday night. Matthew Barrow and Nashid Beard contributed 16 each for Lamar (6-4), and Barrow made 10 of 15 free throws. Forward Thomas Fairley had 13 points and 11 rebounds. The winning streak is Lamar's longest in seven years. Tulsa (3-5) was led by Charles Ramsdell, who had 21 points and eight rebounds. Brett McDade scored 21 points, and Anthony Price had 16 off the bench. Lamar trailed 38-34 at halftime in a game that was tied 11 times and had 14 lead changes. Tulsa shot 48 percent in the first half but slumped to 39 percent after halftime, including 13 percent on 3-pointers (2-of-13). Lamar shot 56 percent in the second half and 49 percent for the game.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
